image.altText: Melbourne Demons coach Simon Goodwin with floodlights behind him.

props.synopsis: Four years after leading Melbourne to a drought-breaking AFL premiership, Simon Goodwin is axed as Demons coach as the team looks set to miss the finals for a second straight season.

title.children: Demons dump coach who led AFL club to first premiership in 57 years

image.altText: A faint blue flame is burning from a gas element on a stainless steel cooktop

props.synopsis: The announcement by Solstice Energy will affect more than 1,000 customers, who will be forced to go electric or change to bottled gas.

title.children: Gas supply to 10 regional Victorian towns to be cut by end of 2026

image.altText: Graphic of a woman looking out onto a hospital. She looks disheveled with messy hair, back turned against the shot.

props.synopsis: Two psychiatrists have told the ABC authorities failed to help protect them from a patient who allegedly violently attacked them and other health professionals.

title.children: Psychiatrists say pleas for protection from violent patient 'ignored'

image.altText: A woman with blonde hair and glasses wearing a denim jacket stands on a rural block.

props.synopsis: Melanie and David Moor spent their life savings building a home on a newly subdivided block in Victoria. But they could lose it all after accidentally building on the wrong block.

title.children: Messy legal battle underway after couple builds house on wrong block

image.altText: CCTV footage of a man in a car park.

props.synopsis: Police are investigating a stabbing and affray in northern Victoria which led to two men being taken to hospital.

title.children: Manhunt underway after two men stabbed in Shepparton

image.altText: Aunty Joy Murphy holds Indigenous artwork during a Welcome To Country. Greg Inglis and Jesse Bromwich are behind her.

props.synopsis: The Melbourne Storm apologises for the late cancellation of a Welcome to Country ceremony which had been scheduled to be held prior to its Anzac Day match.

title.children: Melbourne Storm apologises for cancelled Welcome to Country in Anzac Round

image.altText: A police officer and a distressed looking woman sit opposite one another at a dining table in a house.

props.synopsis: Erin Patterson is seen handing over a "dummy" phone during a police search of her home, in new vision released by the Supreme Court.

title.children: 'I'll seize that now': Court releases Erin Patterson trial footage

image.altText: CCTV footage of a store alight

props.synopsis: We can now conclude that the strategy of taxing and banning nicotine addiction out of existence is a complete failure. The result is organised crime making about $10 billion a year in revenue.

title.children: Australia's illegal tobacco problem has jumped from tragedy to farce

image.altText: A search and rescue aircraft.

props.synopsis: A pilot flying his wife and their dog across Bass Strait in a small plane did not advise authorities of the flight as required — with no distress call made before the aircraft went missing on Saturday, authorities say.

title.children: 'No distress call' from plane missing over Bass Strait, police say

image.altText: A shoulders-up portrait of politician Tanya Plibersek

props.synopsis: The federal frontbencher says it's a matter for Victoria whether working from home is legislated to enshrine the right for the state's employees.

title.children: 'Not marking their homework': Plibersek at ease with Vic work from home plan

image.altText: water tower with booktower sign in Wodonga

props.synopsis: A new bookshop in a Wodonga water tower is the latest unique heritage building being transformed in Victoria.

title.children: Victoria's newest bookstore opens in century-old water tower

image.altText: Black and white still from CCTV footage of a man wearing a Scream mask and black clothing riding an e-scooter

props.synopsis: CCTV footage shows a masked male spray painting offensive phrases on a Melbourne synagogue.

title.children: Police release CCTV footage of male defacing Melbourne synagogue

image.altText: A country road with 'road closed' signs.

props.synopsis: The 18-year-old was driving a hatchback in extremely foggy conditions when she collided with a ute towing a trailer. The male driver of the ute sustained non-life-threatening injuries.

title.children: Woman dies in foggy road crash in Latrobe Valley

image.altText: A middle aged woman with glasses stands in front of Sale train station's purple signboard.

props.synopsis: More services will be added to the Gippsland line later this year, but commuters' patience is running short after battling disruptions since 2018, when upgrades began.

title.children: V/Line commuters fed up after two months without trains to east Gippsland

image.altText: GettyImages-2187549030

props.synopsis: North Melbourne star Jasmine Garner will have the added responsibility of guiding her side through the club's premiership defence in her first season as captain.

title.children: The unique hangover cure bonding AFLW premiers for life

image.altText: A man and woman hold dogs in their arms

props.synopsis: As demand for truffle flavour grows, the industry fears most people are not getting the real deal.

title.children: Do you know what a real truffle tastes like?

image.altText: Pro-Palestinian protesters cross Sydney Harbour Bridge with flags, signs and umbrellas

props.synopsis: Tens of thousands took to the Sydney Harbour Bridge to highlight the humanitarian situation in Gaza and push for action by the Australian government, as thousands more rallied in central Melbourne.

title.children: Confusion after police end Sydney Harbour Bridge protest over 'crowd crush' fears

image.altText: Here's Leonardo Puglisi setting up to anchor the 6 News Sunday night bulletin.

props.synopsis: Australian teenagers have grown up on YouTube and admit it can be harmful, but some say the government's blanket ban will do little to address the problems.

title.children: Australian teens reflect on losing YouTube, a gen Z cultural fixture

image.altText: small needles in the skin

props.synopsis: The Health Complaints Commisioner investigates after reports two women were treated for lung damage after receiving a dry needling procedure at a regional Victorian massage clinic.

title.children: Patients treated for lung injuries after dry needling procedure

image.altText: A man sits in front of a bright blue car covered in advertisements.

props.synopsis: In the 80s, racing car Tru Blu was rebuilt thanks to crowdfunding. Now history has repeated to build a cherished replica.

title.children: Town rallies to help man build his dream car after cancer diagnosis

image.altText: Two people embrace

props.synopsis: After a lacklustre start to the 2025 season, the Melbourne Vixens upset minor premiers West Coast Fever in the Super Netball grand final, 59-58.

title.children: Fairytale finish for Vixens coach after mid-season resignation

image.altText: Close-up of part of a grey and white air purifier.

props.synopsis: Even air purifiers with the best filters vary in how well they clear your home of smoke. Here's what to look for in a unit, and how to make the most of it.

title.children: Wood smoke can harm your health. Can an air purifier protect you?

image.altText: Boy wearing apron and cap standing outside a food truck in a school car park

props.synopsis: As school refusal numbers rise, one Victorian school has implemented a unique program to help re-engage students.

title.children: Daniel thought he'd never finish high school but flexible learning was a lifeline

image.altText: Police tape at a crime scene

props.synopsis: Police say they arrived at a Coleraine home to find an injured woman, who died at the scene.

title.children: Man charged with murder over woman's death in south-west Victoria

image.altText: A turquoise and dark blue artists rendition of the path of underwater cables stretching from Tasmania to the mainland.

props.synopsis: The Tasmanian government has released a summary of the business case for Marinus Link, a second undersea electricity interconnector between Tasmania and Victoria. The summary, released a day after the deal was signed, predicts opportunities — but also comes with warnings.

title.children: Silence over Marinus Link deal defended, but it could cost Liberals government

image.altText: A woman with cropped dark curly hair stands leaning against a bright pink mural.

props.synopsis: When it comes to suicide prevention, Samantha McIntosh knows more than most, and senior lecturer Dr Anton Isaacs believes her lived experience is essential to turning the tide in Australia's mental health space.

title.children: Meet the woman pushing to turn suicide prevention on its head

image.altText: A beach with dynamic blue waves washing against a sandbag wall, with a building on top of it.

props.synopsis: Inverloch residents on Victoria's Bass Coast believe a rock bag wall will solve their erosion problem, but a similar wall nearby has simply shifted the issue up the beach.

title.children: Coastal town hunts for a fix to erosion eating 10m of beach a year

image.altText: Two men sitting together with a photo on their lap of a third man dated circa 1875.

props.synopsis: For 150 years, the Letts family has run Donald's local newspaper, and at 95, editor Robin Letts is still leading the newsroom.

title.children: After 150 years, Australia's longest newspaper dynasty is set to change hands

image.altText: Logan Morris gestures to the crowd in celebration while teammates and opponents react behind him

props.synopsis: Brisbane underlines its premiership credentials with an impressive 27-point win over Collingwood at the MCG.

title.children: Lions make a statement with imperious MCG win over Magpies

image.altText: Education stock image

props.synopsis: When our parliaments, newsrooms, judicial benches and many other institutions all look a certain way, it is clear who is at the centre of Australia's monoculture.

title.children: The cracks are showing in what we tell ourselves about multiculturalism

image.altText: A close up of Jactina Allan speaking at a media event.

props.synopsis: Victorians will be able to work at least two days a week from home under the state governments new plan to develop legal protections for employees.

title.children: Victorian government to enshrine working from home rights

image.altText: A woman holding a leg of pork

props.synopsis: Victorian farmer Tammi Jonas says it has taken her several years to get the planning permits for her micro abattoir, but she is now celebrating changes that will substantially lower the red tape.

title.children: Red tape cut for farmers wanting to build small abattoirs

image.altText: a portrait photograph of Kevin Bell wearing a suit in studio lighting

props.synopsis: A former Yoorrook justice commissioner and Victorian Aboriginal community leaders are urging the state government to make good on the "genuine promise" it made by setting up Australia's first Aboriginal-led truth-telling inquiry.

title.children: 'Urgent beyond words': Former Yoorrook commissioner speaks out since findings

image.altText: An empty university lecture hall.

props.synopsis: The 74-year-old man is facing three charges after inappropriate images were allegedly displayed by accident during the lecture in Melbourne earlier this year.

title.children: Academic charged after child abuse material allegedly shown in lecture

image.altText: A blue hospital building.

props.synopsis: Monash Health in Melbourne's south-east has discovered black mould in an area where cancer patients are treated.

title.children: Major Melbourne hospital discovers black mould in cancer treatment area
